oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Aaron Burr
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Portrait of Aaron Burr (1756-1836), taken from James Parton's Life and Times of Aaron Burr (published 1858). Portrait is a bust, profile looking right. Text underneath reads, "from James Patterson's Life of Aaron Burr, published 18558. A. Burr"
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Vice presidents; Politicians
Burr, Aaron, 1756-1836; Vice-Presidents -- United States -- Biography.; United States -- Politics and government -- 1783-1809.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Burr was an American Revolutionary officer and political leader who served as vice president during Thomas Jefferson's first administration (1801-1805). On July 11, 1804, Burr was involved in a duel with former Secretary of the Treasury Alexander Hamilton. Because Hamilton had publicly criticized him, Burr issued a challenge. Hamilton was mortally wounded and died the next day.
